sp.p: He said he knew Mrs. Stopfort 's friends were rather anxious about her future and he wanted them to know that he was going to marry her as soon as she was free .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Oh !

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Of course it 's the only decent thing to do , but I was n't sure if he 'd see it . He 's a very good fellow .With a smile .He spent at least half an hour telling me how he adored Mrs. Stopfort .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Good-humouredly .Oh , you know I 'm not the sort of woman to grouse because you 're a little late . I can always occupy myself by thinking how wonderful it will be to see you . And if I get bored with that I read your letters again .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I should n't have thought they were worth that .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I think I have every word you have ever written to me — those old letters of ten years ago and the little notes you write to me now . Even though they 're only two or three lines , saying you 'll come here or can n't come , they 're precious to me .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: But do you keep them here ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Yes , they 're safe here . They 're locked up in that box . Only amah has the key of this room ... George .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Will you do something for me ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: If I can .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Will you dine here to-night ? Amah will get us a lovely little dinner .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Oh , my dear , I can n't ! I 've got an official dinner that I can n't possibly get out of .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Oh , how rotten !

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: But I thought Harry was coming back this morning . He 's been gone a week already .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I had a letter saying he had to go on to Kalgan . But do n't say anything about it . He told me I was to keep it a secret .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: He must hate having to be away so much as he 's been lately . The death of that man Gregson has upset things rather .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Smiling .I wish I could thank Gregson for the good turn he did us by dying at the psychological moment .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Dryly .I do n't suppose that was his intention .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Except for that Harry would have insisted on going to Chung-king . Now there 's no possibility of that for at least a year .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I suppose not .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: We 've got a year before us , George , a whole year . And in a year anything can happen .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Gravely .Do you never have any feeling that we 've behaved rottenly to Harry ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I ? I 've been happy for the first time in my life . At last I 've known peace and rest . Oh , George , I 'm so grateful for all you 've given me ! In these three months you 've changed the whole world for me . I thought I could n't love you more than I did . I think every day my love grows more consuming .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: With a sigh .I 've never known a single moment 's happiness .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: That 's not true . When I 've held you in my arms I 've looked into your eyes and I 've seen .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Oh , I know . There 've been moments of madness in which I forgot everything but that I loved you . I 'm a low rotten cad . No one could despise me more than I despise myself . I 've loved you so that there was room for nothing else in my soul . Waking and sleeping you 've obsessed me .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: That 's how I want you to love me .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: And I 've hated myself for loving you . I 've hated you for making me love you . I 've struggled with all my might and a hundred times I thought I 'd conquered myself and then the touch of your hand , the softness of your lips — I was like a bird in a cage , I beat myself against the bars and all the time the door was open and I had n't the will to fly out .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Tenderly .Oh , darling , why do you make yourself unhappy when happiness lies in the hollow of your hand ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Have you never regretted anything ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Never .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: You 're stronger than I am . I 'm as weak as dishwater . It 's funny that it should have taken me all these years to find it out . I was weak from the beginning . But I was weakest of all that day . I was distracted , I thought you were dying , I forgot everything except that I loved you .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: With passion .Oh , my sweetheart ! Do n't you remember how , late in the night , we went outside the temple and looked at the moonlight on the walls of the Forbidden City ? You had no regrets then .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Going on with his own thoughts .And afterwards your tears , your happiness , the dread of giving you pain and the hot love that burnt me — I was in the toils then . I too knew a happiness that I had never known before . On one side was honesty and duty and everything that makes a man respect himself — and on the other was love . I thought you 'd be going away in two or three weeks and that would be the end of it . Oh , it was no excuse — there are no excuses for me , I can never look Harry in the face again , but though my heart was breaking at the thought , I — I knew that in a few days I should see you for the last time .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Scornfully .Do you think I 'd have gone then ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: And then came that sudden , unexpected , disastrous change in all Harry 's plans . And this house and all the sordid horror of an intrigue . And then there was nothing to do but face the fact that I was a cur . I would n't wish my worst enemy the torture that I 've undergone .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Full of love and pity .Oh , my darling , you know I 'd do anything in the world to give you happiness !

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Sombrely looking away from her .Daisy , I think you can never give me happiness , but you can help me , not to make amends because that 's impossible , but to ...Impulsively , looking at her now .Oh , Daisy , do you really love me ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: With all my heart . With all my soul .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Then help me . Let us finish .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Quickly .What do you mean ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I do n't want to seem a prig . I do n't want to preach . Heaven knows , I 've never pretended to be a saint . But what we 've done is wrong . You must see that as plainly as I do .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Is it wrong to love ? How can I help it ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Daisy , I want to — cease doing wrong .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: You make me impatient . How can you be so weak ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I want you to believe that I love you . But I can n't go on with this deceit . I 'd sooner shoot myself .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: You could n't say that if you loved me as I love you .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Brutally .I do n't love you any more .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: With a scornful shrug .That 's not true .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Clenching his teeth .I came here to-day to tell you that — well , that it 's finished and done with . Oh , God , I do n't want to make you unhappy ! But you must see we can n't go on . Everything that 's decent in me revolts at the thought . I beseech you to forget me .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: As if I could .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I 'm going away for a bit .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Startled .You ? Why ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I did n't trust myself , you see ; I 've lost my nerve , so I applied for short leave . I 'm sailing for Vancouver on the Empress . I leave here the day after to-morrow .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Suddenly distraught .You do n't mean that you 're going to leave me ? I did n't pay any attention to what you said . I thought it was just a mood . George , George , say that you do n't mean that ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: It 's the only thing to do , for your sake and Harry 's and mine .Taking his courage in both hands .This is good-bye , Daisy .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Seizing him by the shoulders .Let me look at your eyes . George , you 're crazy . You can n't go .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Drawing away .For God 's sake , do n't touch me . I wanted to break it to you gently . I do n't know what 's happened . Everything has gone wrong . I 'm going , Daisy , and nothing in the world can move me . I implore you to bear it bravely .She looks at him with suffering , anxious eyes . She is stunned .I 'm afraid you 're going to be awfully unhappy for a little while . But I beseech you to have courage . Soon the pain wo n't be so great , and then you 'll see I 've done the only possible thing .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Sullenly .How long are you going for ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Three or four months .A pause .I knew you 'd be brave , Daisy . Do you know , I was afraid you 'd cry most awfully . It tears my heart to see you cry .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Do you think I 'm a child ? Do you think I can cry now ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: It 's good-bye , then , Daisy .

div.stage: She does not answer . She hardly hears what he says . He hesitates an instant wretchedly , and then goes quickly out of the room . DAISY stands as if she were turned to stone . Her face is haggard . In a minute LEE TAI comes softly in . He stands at the door , looking at her , then gives a little cough . She turns round and sees him .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Fiercely .What do you want ?

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: I was waiting till you were disengaged .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Have you been listening ?

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: I have heard .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I wish I could have seen you with your ear to the keyhole . You must have looked dignified .

div.stage: She begins to laugh , angrily , hysterically , beside herself .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: Let me give you a cup of tea . It 's quite warm still .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I should have thought you were rather old and fat to stoop so much .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: Fortunately the windows are only covered with rice paper , so I was saved that inconvenience .

div.stage: He hands her a cup of tea . She takes it and flings it at him . The tea is splashed over his black robe .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Get out of here or I 'll kill you .

div.stage: He wipes his dress with a large silk pocket handkerchief .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: You forget sometimes the manners that were taught you at that elegant school for young ladies in England .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I suppose you 've come to crow over me . Well , crow .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: I told you that I thought I should not have to wait very long .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Scornfully .You fool . Do you think it 's finished ?

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: Did I not tell you that the white man 's love was weak and vacillating ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: He 's going away for four months . Do you think that frightens me ? He 's loved me for ten years . I 've loved him for ten years . Do you think he can forget me in four months ? He 'll come back .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: Not to you .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Yes , yes , yes . And when he comes it 'll be for good . He 'll hunger for me as he hungered before . He 'll forget his scruples , his remorse , his stupid duties , because he 'll only remember me .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: Very quietly .He 's going to be married to Miss Sylvia Knox .

div.stage: DAISY springs at him and seizes him by the throat .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: That 's a lie . That 's a lie . Take it back . You pig .

div.stage: He takes her hands and drags them away from his throat . He holds her fast .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: Ask your mother . She knows . The Chinese all know .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Calling .Amah , amah . It 's a lie . How dare you ?

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: He told you he was going to an official dinner , but he did n't tell you that as soon as he could get away he was going to play bridge at the Knoxes ’ . Pity you do n't play . They might have asked you too .

div.stage: The AMAH comes in .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: You call me , Daisy ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Snatching her hands away .Let me go , you fool .To the AMAH .He says George Conway is engaged to Harold Knox 's sister . It 's not true .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: I no sabe . George 's boy say so . Knox the night before last at the club , he say to his friend , George Conway and my sister , they going to make a match of it .

div.stage: A horrible change comes over DAISY 'S face as all its features become distorted with rage and jealousy .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: The liar .

div.stage: She stares in front of her , hatred , anger , and mortification seething in her heart . Then she gives a cruel malicious chuckle . She goes quickly to the Korean chest and flings it open . She takes out a parcel of letters and crossing back swiftly to LEE TAI thrusts them in his hands .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: What is this ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: They 're the letters he wrote me . Let them come into Harry 's hands .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: Why ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: So that Harry may know everything .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: After a moment 's thought .And what will you do for me if I do this for you ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: What you like .... Only they must get to him quickly . George goes away the day after to-morrow .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: Where is your husband ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Kalgan .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: The letters shall reach him to-morrow morning . I 'll send them by car .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: It 'll be a pleasant surprise for his breakfast .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: Daisy .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Go quickly — or I shall change my mind . There 'll be plenty of time for everything else after to-morrow .

sp.speaker: LEE TAI
sp.p: I 'll go .

div.stage: LEE TAI goes out . DAISY gives him a look of contempt .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Fool .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: What you mean , Daisy ?

lg.l: Harry will divorce me . And then ....
lg.stage: DAISY gives a little cry of triumph .
lg.l: END OF SCENE VI
SCENE VII
The sitting-room in the ANDERSONS ’ apartments .
The scene is the same as SCENE IV . DAISY and the AMAH .
DAISY is walking restlessly backwards and forwards .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: At what time does the train from Kalgan get in ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Five o'clock , my think so .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: What time is it now ?

div.stage: The AMAH takes a large gold watch out and looks at it .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: My watch no walkee .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Why do n't you have it mended ? What 's the good of a watch that does n't go ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Gold watch . Eighteen carats . Cost velly much money . Give me plenty face .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Impatiently .Go and ask Wu what time it is .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: I know time . I tell by the sun . More better than European watch . I think half-past four perhaps .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Why does n't George come ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Perhaps he velly busy .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: You gave him the note yourself ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Yes , I give him letter .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: What did he say ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: He no say nothing . He look : damn , damn .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Did you tell him it was very important ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: I say , you come quick . Chop-chop .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: I tell you before . Why you want me tell you again ? He say he come chop-chop when he get away from office .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: As if the office mattered now . I ought to have gone to him myself .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: You no make him come more quick because you walk up down . Why you no sit still ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: The train is never punctual . It 'll take Harry at least twenty minutes to get out here .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Lee Tai ....

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Interrupting .Do n't talk to me of Lee Tai . Why on earth should I bother about Lee Tai ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Taking up an opium pipe that is on the table .Shall Amah make her little Daisy a pipe ? Daisy very restless .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Have you got opium ?

lg.l: Lee Tai give me some .
lg.stage: She shows DAISY a small tin box .
lg.l: Number one quality . You have one little pipe , Daisy .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: No .

div.stage: WU comes in with a card . He gives it to DAISY .
Miss Knox . Say I 'm not at home .

sp.speaker: WU
sp.p: Yes , missy .

div.stage: He is about to go out .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Stop . Is she alone ?

sp.speaker: WU
sp.p: She ride up to gate with gentleman and lady . She say can she see you for two , three minutes .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: After a moment 's consideration .Tell her to come in .

div.stage: WU goes out .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: What you want to see her for , Daisy ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Mind your own business .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: George come very soon now .

lg.l: I shall get rid of her as soon as he does .
I want to see for myself .

div.stage: SYLVIA comes in . She wears a riding-habit . DAISY greets her cordially . Her manner , which was restless , becomes on a sudden gay , gracious , and friendly .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Oh , my dear , how sweet of you to come all this way !

div.stage: The AMAH slips out .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: I can only stop a second . I was riding with the Fergusons and we passed your temple . I thought I 'd just run in and see how you were . I have n't seen you for an age .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Are the Fergusons waiting outside ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: They rode on . They said they 'd fetch me in five minutes .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Smiling .How did your bridge party go off last night ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: How on earth did you hear about that ? Did Mr. Conway tell you ? I wish you played bridge . We really had rather a lark .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: George did n't come in till late , I suppose ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Oh , no , he got away in fairly decent time . Where there 's a will there 's a way , you know , even at official functions .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: With a little laugh .Oh , I know ! I 'm expecting him here in a minute . I hope you wo n't have to go before he comes .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Well , I saw him yesterday . I can live one day without seeing him .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I wonder if he can live one day without seeing you ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: I 'm tolerably sure he can do that .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: As if she were merely teasing .A little bird has whispered to me that there 's a very pretty blonde in Peking ....

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Interrupting .Probably peroxide .

lg.l: Not in this case . Who is not entirely indifferent to the
Assistant Chinese Secretary at the British Legation .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Fancy !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I suppose you have n't an idea who I 'm talking about ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Not a ghost .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Then why do you blush to the roots of your hair ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: I was outraged at your suggestion that my hair was dyed .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: It 's too bad of me to tease you , is n't it ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: I 'm a perfect owl . You know what a tactless idiot my brother is . He will chaff me about George Conway , so it makes me self-conscious when anybody talks about him .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Darling , it 's nothing to be ashamed of . Why should n't you be in love with him ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: With a laugh .But I 'm not in love with him .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Why does your brother chaff you then ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Because he 's under the delusion that it 's funny .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: But you do like him , do n't you ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Of course I like him .... I think he 's a very good sort .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Would you marry him if he asked you ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: My dear , what are you talking about ? The thought never entered my head .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Oh , what nonsense ! When a man 's as attentive to a girl as George has been to you she can n't help asking herself if she 'd like to marry him or not .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Coldly , but still smiling .Ca n't she ? I 'm afraid I have n't a close acquaintance with that sort of girl .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Am I being very vulgar ? You know , we half-castes are sometimes .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: With a trace of impatience .Of course you 're not vulgar . But I do n't know why you want to talk about something that 's absolute Greek to me .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: The natural curiosity of the Eurasian . Everybody tells me that you 're engaged to George .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Look at my hand .

div.stage: She stretches out her left hand so that DAISY should see there is no ring on the fourth finger . DAISY stares at it for a moment .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: You always used to wear an engagement ring .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Gravely .It was put on my finger by a poor boy who was killed . I meant to wear it always .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Why have you taken it off ?

div.stage: She looks at SYLVIA . She can no longer preserve her artificial gaiety and her voice is cold and hard . Before SYLVIA can answer GEORGE CONWAY comes in .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Regaining with an effort her earlier sprightliness .There you are at last .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I could n't come sooner . I was with the Minister .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: We were wondering why you were so late .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Daisy was wondering .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Shaking hands with Sylvia .I thought that was your pony outside .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Clever .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: The Fergusons were just riding up as I came .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Oh , they 've come to fetch me ! I must bolt .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I 'm afraid we kept you up till all sorts of hours last night .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Not a bit . Do I look jaded ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Of course not . You young things can stay up till three in the morning and be as fresh as paint . Wait till you 're my age .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: You have n't passed your hundredth birthday yet , have you ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Not quite . But I 'm old enough to be your father .

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: I will not stay and listen to you talk rubbish . Good-bye , Daisy . Do come and see me one day this week .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Good-bye .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I 'll come and help you mount , shall I ?

sp.speaker: SYLVIA
sp.p: Oh , no , do n't bother ! Mr. Ferguson is there .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Oh , all right !

div.stage: She goes out .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Her smiles vanishing , hostile and cold .You might shut the door .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Doing so .I will .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Are n't you going to kiss me ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Daisy .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Hastily .Oh , no , it does n't matter ! Do n't bother .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: You said you wanted to see me very importantly .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: It 's kind of you to have come .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: With an effort at ease of manner .My dear child , what are you talking about ? You must know that if there 's anything in the world I can do for you I 'm only too anxious to do it .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Is that girl in love with you ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Good heavens , no ! What put that idea in your head ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: The eyes in my head .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: What perfect nonsense !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Has it never occurred to you that she was in love with you ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Never .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Why do you lie to me ? I 've been told that you were engaged to her .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: That 's ludicrous . It 's absolutely untrue .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Yes , I think it is . At the first moment I believed it . And then I thought it over and I knew it could n't be true . I do n't think you 'd do anything underhand .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: At all events I should n't do that .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: In fairness to me or in fairness to her ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: My dear Daisy , what are you talking about ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Did you break with me yesterday so that you might be free to propose to her ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: No , I swear I did n't .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Why are you so emphatic ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Oh , Daisy , what 's the good of tormenting yourself and tormenting me ? You know I loved you just as much as you loved me . But I 'm not like you . It was a torture . I knew it was wrong and hateful . I could n't go on .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Do you think it would have seemed wrong and hateful if it had n't been for Sylvia ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: You do n't say that very convincingly .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I do think it is because she is so loyal , and good and straight that I saw so clearly what a cad I was . I think I found courage to do the only possible thing in her frankness and honesty .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I think you deceive yourself . Are you sure this admiration of yours for all her admirable qualities is n't — love ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: My dear , I 'm unfit to love her .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: She does n't think so . If you asked her to marry you she 'd accept .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Impatiently .What nonsense . What in heaven 's name made you think that ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I made it my business to find out .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Well , you can set your mind at rest . I 'm not going to ask her to marry me .

div.stage: The AMAH comes in .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Five o'clock , Daisy .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Leave me alone .

div.stage: The AMAH goes out .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: When does Harry come back ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: After a pause , in a strange , hoarse voice .To-day .

lg.stage: Surprised at her tone and manner .
lg.l: Is anything the matter ,
Daisy ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I 'm afraid I have some very bad news for you .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Startled .Oh !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: You know those letters . I kept them locked in the box . Lee Tai was furious because I would n't have anything to do with him . Last night he broke open the box . He 's sent the letters to Harry .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Overwhelmed .My God !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I 'm awfully sorry . It was n't my fault . I could n't dream that there was any risk .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Was that why you sent for me ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Say you do n't hate me .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Oh , poor Harry !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Do n't think of him now . Think of me .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: What do we matter now , you and I ? We 're a pair of rotters . Harry is a white man through and through . He loved you , and he trusted me .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: What are we going to do ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Give me a minute . I 'm all at sixes and sevens . It 's such a knock-out blow .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Harry will be here soon . His train 's due at five .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: We 'll wait for him .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: What ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Did you think I was going to run away ? I 'll stay and face him .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: He 'll kill you .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: With anguish .I wish to God he would .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Oh , George , how can you be so cruel ? Do n't you love me any more ? I love you . George , what is to become of me if you desert me ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Harry loves you so much and he loves me too . Heaven knows what sacrifices he 's not capable of . Oh , I 'm so ashamed !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Why do you bother about him ? He does n't count . He 'll get over it . After all , what can he do ? He can only divorce me and perhaps we can get him to let me divorce him .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Could you allow him to do that ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: It means so little to a man . I do n't care , I was thinking of you . It would make it so much easier for you .He gives her a quick look . He perceives the allusion to marriage .George , George , you would n't leave — leave me in the cart .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Of course I 'll marry you .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Smiling now , loving and tender .Oh , George , we shall be so happy . And you know , some day I 'm sure you 'll think it 's better as it 's turned out . I hate all this deceit just as much as you do . Oh , it 'll make such a difference when our love can be open and above board . When I 'm your wife you 'll forget all that has tormented you . Oh , George , I know we shall be happy !

div.stage: All this time GEORGE has been thinking deeply .

lg.l: How do you know that Lee Tai sent those wretched letters to
Harry ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: He sent me a message . He was n't satisfied with doing a dirty trick . He wanted me to know that he 'd done it .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: How did he know you kept my letters there ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I told you I was reading them while I waited for you . He came in and I put them away . I suppose he suspected . It was very easy for him to get into the room after amah and I went away .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Sarcastically .Had you left the key of the box on the table ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: What do you mean , George ? I 'd locked it up . Of course I took the key with me . I suppose he broke it open . What does it matter ? The harm 's done .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: How do you know Harry received the letters this morning ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Lee Tai said he would .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: In Kalgan ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: How did he know Harry was in Kalgan ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: The Chinese know all one 's movements .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: They can n't do miracles . Harry was going up there unexpectedly on a private mission . The fellows in that company know very well how to keep their own counsel when it 's needful .... I imagine you were the only person in Peking who knew Harry was going to Kalgan .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Casually .Well , it appears I was n't .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: How do you suppose Lee Tai found out something that Harry had particularly told you to keep quiet about ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: How can I tell ? He may have found out from the amah for all I know .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Surely you had n't told her ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Of course not . She may have read the letter . She always does read my letters .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Can she read English ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Enough to find out about other people 's business .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Why should she have told Lee Tai ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I suppose he bribed her . She 'd do anything for a hundred dollars .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Not if it would do you harm .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: She 's not so devoted to me as all that .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: She 's your mother , Daisy .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Quickly .How d'you know ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Harry told me .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I thought he was too ashamed of it to do that .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Persistently .How did Lee Tai know that Harry was in Kalgan ?

lg.l: I tell you I do n't know . Why do you cross-examine me ? Good God ,
I 'm harassed enough without that ! What do you mean ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: He seizes her wrists and draws her violently to him .Daisy , did you send those letters to Harry yourself ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Never ! Do you think I 'm crazy ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Did you give them to Lee Tai to send ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: God damn you , speak the truth ! I will have the truth for once in your life .

div.stage: They stare at one another . He is stern and angry . She pulls herself together . She is fierce and defiant . She shakes herself free of him .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I gave them to Lee Tai .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Hiding his face with his hands .My God !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: He told me you were engaged to Sylvia . For a moment I believed it and I gave him the letters . I hardly knew what I was doing . And now , even though I know it was n't true , I 'm glad . I wish I 'd done it long before .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: You fiend !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Violently .Do you think I 'm going to let you go so easily ? Do you think I 've done all I have to let you marry that silly little English girl ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: With anguish .Oh , Daisy , how could you ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Has it never struck you how you came to be wounded that night ? It was n't you they wanted . It was Harry .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I know .Suddenly understanding .Daisy !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Yes , I could do that . I only wish it had succeeded .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I can n't believe it .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: You 're mine , mine , mine , and I 'll never let you go .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: With increasing violence .Do you think I can ever look at you again without horror ? In my heart I 've known always that you were evil . Ten years ago when I first loved you there was a deep instinct within that warned me . Even though my heart was breaking for love of you I knew that you were ruthless and cruel . I 've loved you , yes , but all the time I 've hated you . I 've loved you , but with the baser part of me . All that was in me that was honest and decent and upright revolted against you . Always , always . This love has been a loathsome cancer in my heart . I could n't rid me of it without killing myself , but I abhorred it . I felt that I was degraded by the love that burned me .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: What do I care so long as you love ? You can think anything you like of me . The fact remains that you love me .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: If you had no pity for Harry , who raised you from the gutter and gave you everything he had to give , oh , if you 'd loved me you 'd have had mercy on me . What do you think our life can be together ? Do n't you know what I shall be ? Ruined and abject and hopeless . Oh , not only in the eyes of everyone who knows me shall I be degraded , but in my own . Do you think there 's much happiness for you there ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I shall have you . That 's all the happiness I want . I 'd rather be wretched with you — oh , a thousand times — than happy with anyone else .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Wrathfully , trying to wound her .You were tormenting me just now because you were jealous of Sylvia . Do you know what I felt for her ? It was n't love — at least not what you mean by love . I can never love anyone as I 've loved you and God knows I 'm thankful . But I had such a respect for her . I 've been so wretched and she offered me peace . And I did think that some day when all this horror was over , if I could do something to make myself feel clean again , I should go to her and , all unworthy , ask her if she would take me . And now the bitterest pang of all is to think that she must know what an unspeakable cad I 've always been .

div.stage: He has flung himself into a chair . He is in despair . DAISY goes up to him and going down on her knees beside him puts her arm round him . She is very tender .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Oh , George , I can make you forget her so easily . You do n't know what my love can do . I know I 've been horrible , but it 's only been because I loved you . Ten years ago I was all that she is . I 'm like clay in your hands and you can make me what you will . Oh , George , say you forgive me !

div.stage: In the caressing gestures of her hands as she tries to move him one of them rests by chance on his coat pocket . She feels something hard . He moves slightly away .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Take care .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: What 's that in your pocket ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: It 's my revolver . Since my accident I 've always carried it about with me . It 's rather silly , but the Minister asked me to . He said he 'd feel safer .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Oh , George , if you only knew the agony I suffered when you were brought in ! The remorse , the fear ! I thought I should go mad .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: With a bitter chuckle .It must have been rather a sell for you .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Oh , you can laugh ! I knew you 'd forgive me . My darling .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I 'm sorry for all the rough things I said to you , Daisy . I do n't blame you for anything . You only acted according to your lights . The only person I can blame is myself . It 's only reasonable that I should suffer the punishment .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: My sweetheart !

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: I suppose you know that I shall be quite ruined .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: You 'll have to leave the service . Does that really matter to you very much ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: It was my whole life .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: You 'll get a job in the post office . With your knowledge of the language they 'll simply jump at you . It 's a Chinese service . It has nothing to do with Europeans .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Do you think the postmaster in a small Chinese city is a very lucrative position ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: What does money matter ? If I 'd wanted money I could have got all I wanted from Lee Tai . We can do with very little . You do n't know what a clever housekeeper I am .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: In a level , dead voice .I 'm sure you 're wonderful .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: We 'll go to some city where there are no foreigners . And we shall be together always . We 'll have a house high up on the bank and below us the river will flow , flow endlessly .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: You seem to have got it all mapped out .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: If you only knew how often I 've dreamed of it . Oh , George , I want rest and peace too ! I 'm so tired . I want endless days to rest in .With a puzzled look at him .What is the matter ? You look so strange .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: With a weary sigh .I was thinking of all the things you 've been saying to me .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: If you think it 'll be easier for you if you do n't marry me , you need not . I do n't care anything about that . I 'll be your mistress and I 'll lie hidden in your house so that no one shall know I 'm there . I 'll live like a Chinese woman . I 'll be your slave and your plaything . I want to get away from all these Europeans . After all , China is the land of my birth and the land of my mother . China is crowding in upon me ; I 'm sick of these foreign clothes . I have a strange hankering for the ease of the Chinese dress . You 've never seen me in it ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Never .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: With a smile .You 'd hardly know me . I 'll be a little Chinese girl living in the foreigner 's house . Have you ever smoked opium ?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: No .DAISY takes the AMAH 'S long pipe in her hands .Who does that belong to ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: It 's amah 's . One day you shall try and I 'll make your pipes for you . Lee Tai used to say that no one could make them better than I .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: However low down the ladder you go there 's apparently always a rung lower .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: After you 've smoked a pipe or two your mind grows extraordinarily clear . You have a strange facility of speech and yet no desire to speak . All the puzzles of this puzzling world grow plain to you . You are tranquil and free . Your soul is gently released from the bondage of your body , and it plays , happy and careless , like a child with flowers . Death cannot frighten you , and want and misery are like blue mountains far away . You feel a heavenly power possess you and you can venture all things because suffering cannot touch you . Your spirit has wings and you fly like a bird through the starry wastes of the night . You hold space and time in the hollow of your hand . Then you come upon the dawn , all pearly and gray and silent , and there in the distance , like a dreamless sleep , is the sea .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: You are showing me a side of you I never knew .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Do you think you know me yet ? I do n't know myself . In my heart there are secrets that are strange even to me , and spells to bind you to me , and enchantments so that you will never weary .

div.stage: A pause .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Standing up .I 'll go and get myself a drink . After all these alarums and excursions I really think I deserve it .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Amah will bring it to you .

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.p: Oh , it does n't matter ! I can easily fetch it myself . The whisky 's in the dining-room , is n't it ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: I expect so .

div.stage: He goes out . DAISY goes over to a chest which stands in the room and throws it open . She takes out the Manchu dress which Harry once gave her and handles it smilingly . She holds up in both her hands the sumptuous headdress . There is the sound of a door being locked . DAISY puts down the headdress and looks at the door enquiringly .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: With a little smile .What are you locking the door for , George ?The words are hardly out of her mouth before there is the report of a pistol shot . DAISY gives a shriek and rushes towards the door .George ! George ! What have you done ?She beats frantically on the door .Let me in ! Let me in ! George !

div.stage: The AMAH comes in running from the courtyard .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: What 's the matter ? I hear shot .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Send the boys , quick . We must break down this door .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: I send the boys away . I no want them here when Harry come .

lg.l: George ! George ! Speak to me .
lg.stage: She beats violently on the door .
lg.l: Oh , what shall I do ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Daisy , what 's the matter ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: He 's killed himself sooner — sooner than ....

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Aghast .Oh !

div.stage: DAISY staggers back into the room .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Oh , my God !

div.stage: She sinks down on the floor . She beats it with her fist . The AMAH looks at her for an instant , then with quick determination seizes her shoulder .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Daisy , Harry come soon .

lg.l: Leave me alone . What do I care if
Harry comes ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: You no can stay here . Come with me quick .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Go away . Damn you !

lg.l: Do n't you talk foolish now . You come . Lee
Tai waiting for you .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: With a sudden suspicion .Did you know this was going to happen ? George ! George !

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Harry will kill you if he find you here . Come with me .There is a knocking at the outer gate .There he is . Daisy ! Daisy !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Do n't torture me .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: I bolt that door . He no get in that way . He must come round through temple . You come quick and I hide you . We slip out when he safe .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: With scornful rage .Do you think I 'm frightened of Harry ?

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: He come velly soon now .

div.stage: DAISY raises herself to her feet . A strange look comes over her face .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Lee Tai has made a mistake again . Bolt that door .

div.stage: The AMAH runs to it and slips the bolt . While she does this DAISY takes the tin of opium and quickly swallows some of the contents . The AMAH turns round and sees her . She gives a gasp . She runs forward and snatches the tin from DAISY 'S hand .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: What you do , Daisy ? Daisy , you die !

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Yes , I die . The day has come . The jungle takes back its own .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Distraught .Oh , Daisy ! Daisy ! My little flower .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: How long will it take ?The AMAH sobs desperately . DAISY goes to the Manchu clothes and takes them up .Help me to put these on .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: Dumbfounded .What you mean , Daisy ?

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Curse you , do as I tell you !

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: I think you crazy .DAISY slips into the long skirt and the AMAH with trembling hands helps her into the coat . In the middle of her dressing DAISY staggers .Daisy .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Recovering herself .Do n't be a fool . I 'm all right .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: In a terrified whisper .There 's Harry .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Give me the headdress .

sp.speaker: HARRY
sp.p: Outside .Open the door .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Be quick .

sp.speaker: AMAH
sp.p: I no understand . You die , Daisy . You die .

div.stage: The knocking is repeated more violently .

sp.speaker: HARRY
sp.p: Shouting .Daisy ! Amah ! Open the door . If you do n't open I 'll break it down .

div.stage: DAISY is ready . She steps on to the pallet and sits in the Chinese fashion .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Go to the door . Open when I tell you .

div.stage: There is by DAISY 'S side a box in which are the paints and pencils the Chinese lady uses to make up her face . DAISY opens it . She takes out a hand mirror .

sp.speaker: HARRY
sp.p: Who 's there ? Open , I tell you ! Open !

div.stage: DAISY puts rouge on her cheeks . She takes a black pencil and touches her eyebrows . She gives them a slight slant so that she looks on a sudden absolutely Chinese .

sp.speaker: DAISY
sp.p: Open !

div.stage: The Amah draws the bolt and HARRY bursts in .

sp.speaker: HARRY
sp.p: Daisy !He comes forward impetuously and then on a sudden stops . He is taken aback . Something , he knows not what , comes over him and he feels helpless and strangely weak .Daisy , what does it mean ? These letters .He takes them out of his pocket and thrusts them towards her . She takes no notice of him .Daisy , speak to me . I do n't understand .He staggers towards her with outstretched hands .For God 's sake , say it is n't true .

div.stage: Motionless she contemplates in the mirror the Chinese woman of the reflection .
